Title:
Taxonomic notes on Phylloporia spathulata (Hook.) Ryvarden
and Two undescribed South American stipitate species of Phylloporia
Murrill
Keywords:
Atlantic rain forest, Hymenochaetaceae, living root,
morpho-ecological type
Abstract:
During a taxonomic revision of species belonging to
Phylloporia, some collections from Atlantic Forest of Southern Brazil
previously determined as P. spathulata deserved special attention due to
some morphological discrepancies in comparison to the type material of
this taxon. Both phylogenetic molecular and morphological analysis
revealed them as two undescribed species, presented hereafter.
Phylloporia elegans sp. nov. and P. nodostipitata sp. nov. mainly differ
from P. spathulata by presenting reviving basidiomata, with smaller
pores and basidiospores. Phylloporia nodostipitata develops cespitose
basidiomata, with nodose and flexuous stipes and tomentose upper
surface. Phylloporia elegans develops individual basidiomata, with
cylindrical and straight stipes, and an upper surface as a
plagiotrichoderm. Both species are described, illustrated, discussed and
compared with Phylloporia spathulata based on its type study.
Additionally, some taxonomic notes on P. spathulata are presented in
order to improve its morphological delimitation.
